item.title: How to Install Turtl on Linux
item.description: What is Turtl? Turtl is an open-source alternative to cloud-based storage services. With a focus on privacy, Turtl offers a place to store and access your passwords, bookmarks and pictures. Hosting your own Turtl server on a secure Linode allows you to monitor your own security. The Turtl server is written in Common Lisp, and the low-level encryption is derived from the Stanford JavaScript Crypto Library. If encryption is important to you, read over the encryption specifics section of the official documentation
